result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcos A Avila

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Marcos A Avila in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 14CF130, 14CF194, 14CF254, & 13CM747. In cases 14CF194 & 14CF254  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived. In all cases.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead no contest to Ct. 1 of 14CF254 and no contest to Ct. 1 of 14CF194.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Case 14CF254 Ct. 1 Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 3 years.  $518.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample.  Maintain absolute sobriety. AODA and comply.  30 days jail with Huber, start date to be determined by agent, but must be within first year of probation.  6 month review.  Defendant may petition Court in writing, after three years, for expunction of record, contingent upon no new law violations and fine paid in full.  Dismiss but read in Counts 2,3, & 4.  Case 14CF194 Ct. 1  court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 3 years.  $518.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample.  Maintain absolute sobriety. AODA and comply. 6 month review.  Defendant may petition Court in writing, after three years, for expunction of record, contingent upon no new law violations and fine paid in full.  2 days jail credit due.  Any bond on hand to be applied towards costs.  Dismiss but read in Counts 2,3,4,5,6, & 7.   Cases 13CM747 and 14CF130 Dismissed but read in.

Defendant Marcos A Avila in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 14CF194, 14CF130, & 14CF254.  State receited the recommendation.  Court disagreed with the agreement.  Atty Masana requested matter be reset for new pretrial and return date, to see if counsel can come up with a new agreement.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 12, 2014 at 11:20 am.  Hearing scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 8, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Defendant, Marcos A Avila, appeared. Christine M Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 14CF194 and 14CF130.  Defendant is seeking an atty.   These cases should track together.  Bond remains.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 10:20 am.  Hearing scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant, Marcos A Avila, appeared. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights to attorney and time limits recited. Time limits waived. $1,000 recog. bond, no contact with C.S., not be at 309 W Burns, Portage and  with felony conds.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 10:10 am.  Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
